fields.name: tool_name
fields.title: tool_name
fields.description: The tool must have a well identified name and not being just an item in the menu of a bigger tool (e.g. not the “sustainability check” option in a development tool)

fields.name: organization
fields.title: organization
fields.description: The legal entity having the intellectual property of the tool.

fields.name: website
fields.description: The tool must have a dedicated web page (landing page, github repo, etc.) describing its functionalities, its licensing, a.s.o . Required format is a URL.

fields.name: assessment_type
fields.description: Type of assessment the tool is designed for

fields.name: perimeters
fields.description: What is the general scope covered by the tool. Several values are possible.

enum: Infra / Cloud (for example: GCP, AWS, Azure, OVH Cloud)
Software / Mobile Apps (for example: Android App, iPhone App)
Software / Web Apps (for example: React, Spring, Node.js, ROR, PHP apps)
Software / Web Content (for example: WordPress, Drupal, Prestashop, Magento, etc.)

fields.name: environmental_indicators
fields.description: Environmental indicators utilized by the tool

enum: Final Energy consumption (usually in Joule per WattHour)
GWP: Global Warming Potential aka the carbon footprint usually in CO2 equivalent
ADPf (MJ): Abiotic resource Depletion Potential for fossil fuel usually in Antimony (Sb) equivalent
ADPe (Sbeq): Abiotic resource Depletion Potential for element (minerals, etc.) usually in Antimony (Sb) equivalent
Water Depletion also called water footprint

fields.name: functional_units
fields.description: Functional units considered in the assessment
